title: Kuzmenko's Impact Reminiscent of Past Cup Winning Deadline Deals
snippets: Although it is probably way too early to ponder how the deadline acquisition of Andrey Kuzmenko will play out for the LA Kings in the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs, I am going to do it anyway. Fans and followers of both the 2012 and 2014 Cup winning teams are well aware of what bringing in the right piece at the right time can do for one's team, especially when it's the likes of Jeff Carter and Marion Gaborik.
titles: Kuzmenko's Impact Reminiscent of Past Cup Winning Deadline Deals
summary: The LA Kings acquired Andrey Kuzmenko at the deadline, sparking discussions about its impact on the team's performance in the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs. Reflecting on past successes with deadline acquisitions like Jeff Carter and Marion Gaborik, who significantly contributed to the Kings' 2012 and 2014 Stanley Cup victories, fans and analysts are contemplating the potential benefits of Kuzmenko's addition to the team. The outcome of this move remains to be seen in the upcoming playoffs.

The current status of the case, including any legal actions or outcomes, has not been disclosed.

title: Nvidia, Other Chip Stocks Rally as Trump Says China Tariffs Will Come Down
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Semiconductor stocks jumped Wednesday, a day after President Trump reportedly said tariffs on China "will come down substantially."
  • Shares of Nvidia, Broadcom, AMD, and Intel all traded higher.
  • Semiconductors are presently exempt from the Trump's "reciprocal" tariffs, but analysts have said they expected import taxes targeting the sector to return.


Chip stocks including Nvidia (NVDA) and Broadcom (AVGO) rose sharply Wednesday, a day after President Donald Trump reportedly said the administration's tariffs on China "will come down substantially."

Shares of Nvidia jumped more than 5% in recent trading, Broadcom added 6%, and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) gained 7%. Intel (INTC) shares surged 7% as investors also digested a report that the chipmaker is planning to cut more than 20% of its staff. 

The PHLX Semiconductor Index, which tracks the 30 largest U.S.-listed semiconductor sector, was up about 5.5%.

The rally comes after Trump said late Tuesday he intends to be "very nice" to China in trade negotiations. Semiconductors are presently exempt from the administration's "reciprocal" tariffs, but the administration previously suggested it planned to impose steep import taxes targeting the sector.
titles: Nvidia, Other Chip Stocks Rally as Trump Says China Tariffs Will Come Down
summary: Semiconductor stocks, including Nvidia, Broadcom, AMD, and Intel, experienced significant gains following President Trump's announcement that tariffs on China would "come down substantially." This news led to a sharp increase in share prices, with Nvidia up more than 5%, Broadcom 6%, AMD 7%, and Intel 7%. The PHLX Semiconductor Index, tracking the largest U.S.-listed semiconductor companies, rose by about 5.5%. The surge in stock prices comes amid expectations of improved trade relations between the U.S. and China, with semiconductors currently exempt from Trump's reciprocal tariffs, despite p

title: US stocks jump after Trump soothes Fed independence worries
snippets: Wall Street extends rally after president says he has no plans to fire Jay Powell
titles: US stocks jump after Trump soothes Fed independence worries
summary: Wall Street experienced a continued rally following the President's announcement that he has no intentions of dismissing Jay Powell from his position. This statement contributed to a positive market response, indicating investor confidence in the current leadership and stability of the Federal Reserve.

title: What Elon Musk Said About Tesla's Timelines for Robots, Autonomous Rides and More
snippets:
Investors interested in what Elon Musk says is ahead for Tesla (TSLA), rather than the company’s latest numbers, got some fresh information from the electric vehicle maker’s CEO yesterday. 

On Tesla’s conference call Tuesday, Musk offered up new timelines for developments ranging from robot production to autonomous rides. Those comments, which included a pledge to spend less time on government work, followed the release of first-quarter financial results that included a 20% year-over-year drop in auto revenue. 

Here's a summary of four of Musk's latest pronouncements:

  • Autonomous rides: Musk said Tesla expects to be selling fully autonomous rides in Austin, Texas, in June, with that business expanding to other cities this year and becoming financially material in the second half of 2026. 
  • Unsupervised, self-driving, personally owned cars: That, Musk said, should be available in “several” U.S. cities by the end of 2025, with the goal being “Can you go to sleep in your car and wake up at your destination?” (Musk also said some new Model Y vehicles could deliver themselves to their buyers sometime this year.)
  • Lower-priced Teslas: The company plans to release more affordable Tesla models this year, Musk said. 
  • Optimus robots: Musk said he expects “thousands” of Optimus robots working in Tesla factories by the end of 2025. He said he feels confident that the company will be producing 1 million of the robots a year by 2030. 

“We must execute well,” Musk said on the call, a transcript of which was provided by AlphaSense. “But if we do execute well, I think Tesla will be the most valuable company in the world by far.”
titles: What Elon Musk Said About Tesla's Timelines for Robots, Autonomous Rides and More
summary: Elon Musk, Tesla's CEO, shared new projections on a conference call following the company’s Q1 financial report, which showed a 20% drop in auto revenue year-over-year. Musk's updates included the expectation to sell fully autonomous rides in Austin, Texas, by June, and expand to other cities in 2026. He also mentioned plans for unsupervised, self-driving cars in several U.S. cities by the end of 2025, the release of more affordable Tesla models within the year, and the production of thousands of Optimus robots by the end of 2025, aiming for 1 million annually by 2030. Musk aspires for Tesla t

title: Thermo Fisher Tops Q1 Estimates in 'Uncertain Macroeconomic Environment'
snippets:
Thermo Fisher Scientific (TMO) shares rose Wednesday after the lab equipment and life science solutions firm reported first-quarter results above analysts' expectations.

The Waltham, Mass.-based company posted adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $5.15 on revenue of $10.36 billion. Analysts polled by Visible Alpha projected $5.10 and $10.23 billion, respectively.

"We delivered very strong performance in the first quarter in a more uncertain macroeconomic environment, and I'm incredibly proud of our team's execution," CEO Marc Casper said.

During the firm's earnings call, Thermo Fisher executives said they now see adjusted EPS for the full year a dollar lower at the midpoint, or $22.30, citing the impact of policy changes, including tariffs between the U.S. and China. Analysts had been looking for full-year adjusted EPS of $23.16.

Thermo Fisher shares, which entered the day down 16% in 2025, rose nearly 5% soon after markets opened Wednesday before paring back early gains. (Read Investopedia's live coverage of today's market action here.)
titles: Thermo Fisher Tops Q1 Estimates in 'Uncertain Macroeconomic Environment'
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific reported first-quarter earnings and revenue above analysts' expectations, with an adjusted EPS of $5.15 and revenue of $10.36 billion, surpassing projections of $5.10 and $10.23 billion, respectively. Despite a strong performance in a challenging macroeconomic environment, the company adjusted its full-year EPS forecast down by a dollar to $22.30, mainly due to the impact of policy changes, including U.S.-China tariffs. Following the announcement, Thermo Fisher shares rose nearly 5% but later reduced some of the gains.

title: Branson slams Trump’s ‘erratic’ tariffs
snippets: Billionaire founder of Virgin Group speaks out against potential damage of US economic policies
titles: Branson slams Trump’s ‘erratic’ tariffs
summary: The billionaire founder of Virgin Group publicly criticized US economic policies, warning they could potentially harm the economy. He expressed concerns over the long-term effects these policies might have on business and economic stability.

title: Bats that walk backwards have developed unusual navigation strategy
snippets: Greater mouse-tailed bats crawl backwards over cave walls, and it seems they use their long tails to help feel their way
titles: Bats that walk backwards have developed unusual navigation strategy
summary: Researchers have observed that greater mouse-tailed bats navigate by crawling backwards over cave walls, using their elongated tails as sensory tools to guide their movement. This unique behavior aids in their ability to move in the dark, confined spaces of caves.

title: Powerful blasts of X-rays could reveal a black hole waking from sleep
snippets: Unusual signals called quasi periodic eruptions appear to come from black holes, but we don't know what creates them. Now astronomers have seen the most powerful one of these signals ever, and have a new idea about their cause
titles: Powerful blasts of X-rays could reveal a black hole waking from sleep
summary: Astronomers have detected the most powerful quasi-periodic eruption ever observed emanating from a black hole. This discovery has led to a new hypothesis regarding the cause of these unusual signals, although their exact origin remains unknown.

title: We can build quantum computers using the rules of special relativity
snippets: Machine learning helped show how harnessing the weird effects of Einstein’s special relativity could enable a new kind of quantum computer – and it could also lead to new insights into the quantum realm
titles: We can build quantum computers using the rules of special relativity
summary: Harnessing the peculiar effects of Einstein's special relativity, researchers have made advancements in the development of a new kind of quantum computer. This could also pave the way for fresh insights into the quantum realm. of machine learning inchniques played a crucial role in this breakthrough.

title: Range expansion in lesser goldfinches
snippets: New research shows that Lesser Goldfinches, a small songbird traditionally found in Southwest USA, are expanding their range northward through the Pacific Northwest at an unprecedented rate, providing insights into how species adapt to environmental change.
titles: Range expansion in lesser goldfinches
summary: Recent research indicates that Lesser Goldfinches, traditionally native to the Southwest USA, are now expanding their habitat northward into the Pacific Northwest at a rapid pace. This shift offers valuable insights into how species adjust to environmental changes.

title: Light fields with extraordinary structure: Plasmonic skyrmion bags
snippets: A research group has manipulated light through its interaction with a metal surface so that it exhibits entirely new properties.
titles: Light fields with extraordinary structure: Plasmonic skyrmion bags
summary: A research team has successfully altered the properties of light by interacting it with a metal surface, creating new characteristics for the light. This development represents a significant advancement in the manipulation of light's properties through surface interaction.
